snippet: A brain swelling that is infecting the country’s youth, throwing them into comas and killing seemingly healthy children, often within hours, has stumped the country’s physicians.
abstract: Dr L S Chauhan, director of National Center for Disease Control in India, hopes to discover cause of mysterious form of encephalitis that kills thousands of young children annually in epidemic that starts in mid-May and abruptly ends with onset of monsoon season; with help from Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta, he has trained team of epidemiologists who carefully study individual cases, hoping to find common factors.
lead_paragraph: A brain swelling that is infecting the country’s youth, throwing them into comas and killing seemingly healthy children, often within hours, has stumped the country’s physicians.

headline.main: As Mystery Illness Stalks Its Young, India Intensifies Search for a Killer
